url.title: Going Deep
url.description: Charles Torre travels around Microsoft to meet the companyâ€™s leading Architects and Engineers to discuss the inner workings of our core technologies. Going Deep is primarily concerned with how things &#8230;

video:video.video:title: How WSL accesses Linux files from Windows
video:video.video:description: Sven Groot explains how the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) can access and modify Linux files from Windows applications, going into deep dive level details on the underlying architecture and how it&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Bart De Smet: Rx and Cortana
video:video.video:description: It's always great to spend some time geeking out with Bart De Smet. As usual, he has a lot of technical details to share and only so much whiteboard real estate. Bart is still deeply engaged with Rx&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Inside .NET Native
video:video.video:description: What happens when .NET code is statically compiled to machine code (versus runtime compiled via JIT) by the VC&#43;&#43; back end compiler? You get highly optimized binaries that load and run faster&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Nikolai Tillmann and Peli de Halleux: Inside Code Digger
video:video.video:description: Code Digger is a lightweight version of Pex that allows you to explore public .NET methods in Portable Libraries directly from the Visual Studio 2012 code editor. It's a highly simplified and nifty&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Immo Landwerth and Andrew Arnott: Inside Immutable Collections
video:video.video:description: Immutable Collections are a new set of immutable types for .NET. We covered the high level aspects of this new technology a few months back when Erik Meijer interrogated (in his friendly way) the PM&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Programming the Cloud with Actors: Inside ActorFx
video:video.video:description: ActorFx is an MSOpenTech open source project with the goal of providing a non-prescriptive, language-independent model of dynamic distributed objects. This will in turn provide a framework and&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Inside Windows 8: Chris Stevens - Boot Environment
video:video.video:description: Chris Stevens is a software developer on the Windows kernel team working on the Windows boot environment. Windows 8 boots faster than any other version of Windows. Why? How? Chris begins with the&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Inside Windows 8: Pedro Teixeira - Thread pools
video:video.video:description: Continuing with our series of conversations with engineers in Windows, we meet Pedro Teixeira, a software developer on the Windows kernel team (aka core OS) who has improved the Windows thread pools&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Inside Windows 8: Arun Kishan - Windows App Model
video:video.video:description: Arun Kishan digs into the low level details of Windows 8's new application model. How has Process Lifetime Management (PLM) been reimagined in Windows 8? How does app suspension work, exactly, or,&#8230;

video:video.video:description: By now you've learned that the CLR, Windows Phone Client, and Windows Phone Services teams got together to develop &quot;Compiler in the Cloud&quot;. All Windows Phone 8 apps written in .NET&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Anders Hejlsberg and Lars Bak: TypeScript, JavaScript, and Dart
video:video.video:description: TypeScript, a typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to idiomatic (normal) JavaScript, is designed to make it easier to write cross-platform, application scale, JavaScript that runs in any browser&#8230;

video:video.video:title: C++ and Beyond 2012: Scott Meyers - Universal References in C++11
video:video.video:description: Scott Meyers presents &quot;Universal References in C&#43;&#43;11&quot;. This was filmed at C&#43;&#43; and Beyond 2012. This is the full session in all of its splendor. Huge thanks to Scott for&#8230;

video:video.video:title: C++ and Beyond 2012: Alexandrescu, Meyers, and Sutter - Ask Us Anything

video:video.video:description: The Portable Class Library project enables you to write and build managed assemblies that work on more than one .NET Framework platform. You can create classes that contain code you wish to share&#8230;
